name: yearsinhotclaws
text: SINGED.

name: helloftubby
text: to be fair most of those chubbies were probably given in an attempt to 'balance out' the ridiculous amount of lames you get on comments that from other people would merit neither.

name: baryonyx
text: (Chubbies - Lames)/(total comments) = your worth as an Assetbar user.

name: baryonyx
text: Asherdan, at this point in time, holds a value of roughly -4.31.

name: mockereo
text: asherdan, regaining some ground here, making it back up to a -.67 Ache-worth.

name: asherdan
text: Just as with publicity, there is really no attention that is completely bad.

name: achilleselbow
text: You know what, I've been thinking about this equation and I don't think it works that well, since it basically penalizes one for making innocuous comments that get neither chubbies nor lames. I think something like a Chubby/Lame ratio would be more appropriate, though there should be some way to factor in total comments as well. Any math majors here to construct a needlessly complicated equation?

name: crater12
text: A math equation of this would be oddly satisfying. I wonder how spam posts should be factored in though, maybe a set amount of lames = 1 spam? (given that spam is inherently lame in most cases).

name: baryonyx
text: Spams are hard to track, though. They're not logged anywhere.

name: soticoto
text:
Chubbies - Lames == Popularity.
Popularity / Comments =/= Worth.
Popularity / Comments == Layman's Appeal (i.e. Lame-man's Appeal).

Worth == (Chubbies <plus> (2xLames)) / Comments.

Because all attention is good attention.

name: untilyouaresonude
text:
Me and this Flynn fellow are two different people. You can tell because we each harbor a very particular disdain for people like you who insist they're smarter because they like Anime and they were told by their mothers that it's okay to have been born a douche.

Honestly, I wonder for a quick minute whether you're some kind of joke that Chris Onstad is playing on all of us. I mean, he can write assholes (read: Pat's Blog), and we all know he's inventive enough to make a guy he's certain we'd all hate. Either you are just Onstad's imagination giving us a nice spanking on the ass, or you are Pat incarnate: opinionated over nothing, unwilling to keep things mellow, not at all interested in celebrating the genius that is this comic...which, unlike you, I and others actually read for personal enjoyment. The only joy you seem to get is in diluting yourself into believing anyone cares what you think.

I think I'm done addressing you directly. If you're a real person, then you violate my "don't bother with internet turds" dictum that I hold myself to; if you're a joke, I don't want to persistently be the punchline.

name: profbobo
text:
Chris Onstad said that lame posts would be removed from the site with the next featureset update, so just leave it alone; the community will police out the assholes.

He's really just one dude with a sense of undeserved entitlement, so leave him to roil in his anger. Honestly, I expected more of Achewood fans and although I'll pop into the comments from time to time, I'm mostly soured that dudes like asherdan share a common interest with me.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by UntilYouAreSoNude, Zefiel, apocowarg, lamboyster, GeyserShitdick, Moraiat, bug, theoneyouwant, equinn2006, JuanCarlos, Vee, mira, cognitonaut, profbobo, zulko, Epicurus, usversusthem, psykeres)

name: saint
text:
the lesson is that if you are asherdan your job is to say dicklike things and then point your finger at others and *plplplpl* when they do it back.

go bench press a boner, tinkerbell.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, Cypher, goocifer, rustmouth, usversusthem, Mo_Rose)

name: saint
text:
wow. i have to admit, you got me to laugh, something you haven't done in the past.

Here's the thing. I don't just make assumptions about you. My opinion of you has been carefully crafted throughout time on this messageboard, observing your tendencies as a commenter and responder. My carefully crafted opinion, therefore, is this:

you are an asshole.

and that is okay.

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Norsef, Mangtastic, Cypher, usversusthem, Mo_Rose)

name: saint
text:
See, now here's what I think.
You obviously come from an unnaturally protective homestead, because you suddenly get a boner for this "freedom of speech" business. I'm also guessing that your parents are either divorced...or they're of the same gender and you're adopted. This would explain your outrageous sense of entitlement.

Or, you could just be a giant, veiny cock with nothing better to do than spout third-rate insults at half-wit commenters on a 5-star webcomic.

name: asherdan
text:
So did you circle back to this on a whim or did it take you a year of field research on an 'inter-webs in the wild' grant to craft that one up?

Let me know when you publish the paper. I'll pick a copy up and it can replace my TP for a day.

name: achilleselbow
text:
This whole thing is stupid, but I thought I'd way in on one point: I see a lot of people not being 'mellow' here, but Asherdan is far from the first person that comes to mind.

Scroll up, read his original comment, then read the flamestorm that ensued, and try to imagine being a normal person coming across all this without any pre-conceptions. I don't think you guys realize how ridiculous you would seem.

name: griffypoo
text:
Ah, I see for sure why people hate you now. After reading this whole exchange, I understand. I'm still indifferent because I wasn't around for the thing originally, but even you have to admit that a lot of your combacks here were weak as all hell. Grammar error point-outs? C'mon, man.

I have to say, overall, this is probably the most disappointing story I've ever followed through on. I go through seeing all these lamed-out-of-existence comments thinking "Oh man, this guy must've douched out hardcore! He must've been spamming ads for KKK websites or some shit!". Then I get to the main of it and it turns out to be just another internet argument. What a let-down. :/

name: griffypoo
text:
*comebacks

D'oh.

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked as spam and excluded. retardo: What a douche. (reported by Sakana, NYU, mrn)

name: retardo
text: A comment left by retardo was marked as spam and excluded. retardo: What a douche. (reported by Sakana, NYU, mrn)

name: wulvaine
text:
This makes me feel a little strange. 6 people so far actually lamed Onstad? Which is five more people than just Asherdan, who we expect this sort of thing from because he enjoys being a cock to strangers?

Who actually reads a webcomic enough to have an account with which to comment on the strips, and then when they see a comment by the AUTHOR, lames it?

Keep in mind that Onstad owes you nothing, people. And posting 'FIRST! OMGWTFBBQ!' is stupid, pointless, immature, and really fucking annoying for the rest of us who don't give a shit.

name: baryonyx
text: If it isn't modified by the content it's reacting to, I'd say it's spam. FIRST's, like advertisements, will never change no matter what strip they are in response to.

name: achilleselbow
text: It stands for Stupid Pointless Annoying Messages. "FIRST" posts meet all these criteria, your constant badgering of Onstad regarding his sexuality meet at least two.

name: sabalpalm
text: A comment left by sabalpalm was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Sakana, Overmedicated, kylank, differentdog, mira)

name: gethen
text: i prefer the current setup that protects both your right to read the comic without comments and my right to read those available.  you are not compelled to log in to the assetbar comment system.  unregistered readers do not see any of these comments.  this way, the board can remain visible for those who want to use it while allowing you to not be bothered.

name: sabalpalm
text: True.  I guess it just breaks my heart a little to see people say basically "I don't see why %u2018Philippe standing on%u2019 it is funny."  Maybe I just wanted to assume all this time that all Achewood fans were basically me and not everybody on the whole internet in it's mediocre entirety.

name: mega_panda
text:
I wonder what effect internet forums have on those people who choose to share their creative sides with the world. I wonder how many emotionally fucked up artists, a la jackson pollock, we have already sent into downward spirals of suicidal depression by means of fourteen year-olds wearing Eagles of Death Metal T-shirts. And to top it all off Onstad chose to host a fucking forum on his own comics, for our own benefit, so that we talk and have just have a great old time being fans, and a solid chunk of what we, as an internet community, has to say is that Onstad is gay or that he sucks. That's just shit.

Onstad I apologize for everyone who is a douche to you. You truly are beloved, and your comic is the best hands down.

douche, why you even got to do a thing?

name: soticoto
text: Oh shit. I hit chubby when I meant to give you 1001 lames, on account of that popularist shit being a really REALLY bad idea.

name: side_show
text: punish him by buying lots of T-shirts.  That will show him you mean business!

text: It deserves a third Elvis stamp.

name: shatneresque
text:
I am of the personal opinion that Elvis is kind of a dick. I say this because he almost ran over my dad once. My dad went on to ask Cybill Shepard to prom.
She said no.

name: shatneresque
text:
Even bald Elvis. Wait where was I even going with those stories?
I am sorry assetbar. Signed, Shatneresque.

name: null
text: This is very cool.  I think baseball would be much improved if everyone had a clear acrylic bat with some kind of figurine inside it.

text: A comment left by boojit was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, NYU, typo)

name: girlandagun
text: I really like how people on the message board are already using Achewood-style--or I guess specifically Roast Beef-style--speech patterns in their comments: "all ___," & "and such." I'm not being sarcastic. I really do like this...or at least identify with it, as I've found myself starting to incorporate these into everyday discussion as well. Which is, ok, maybe a little weird.

name: misterwolf
text:
Beef is basically the archtypal geek. And what with Achewood being on the web and all, guess who reads it? I'm guessing 92-97% of Achewood's readership identifies strongly with Rost Beef.

Myself, I imagine Beef talking in sort of an impatient monotone, bereft of emotional association and wanting to get the words out as quickly as possible so he can stop talking.

name: zefiel
text: I like that Idea I also talk fast. Myself, English is my second Language, so I definitely incorporate Beef's idioms into my everyday lexicon. I have also gotten a lot of people to add 'Basically' and 'Ten kinds of__'

name: dartigen
text: English is my native lanuguage and I still use Beef-isms. It just kind of happens I guess.

name: rizzle
text: I definitely said "oh hell and damn yes give me that thing" yesterday :/

name: typo
text: I'm thinking more like the other way around.. People who read this strip are representative, to a degree, of those who speak or think these ways.  I suppose some people who read the strip have decided, subconsciously or otherwise, to change their speech patterns when discussing the strip, but I should at least hope that that is the exception.

name: theboneorchard
text: It seems hell of appropriate.

name: mrshl
text: This premise seemed kinda thin at first. I'm now digging the arc, though. I'm not even sure it's the strip, necessarily. Just that Beef's glass bubble reminds me of the cones of silence in Maxwell Smart and the Nude Bomb . I needed to remember that.

text: This one is really good overall.  Achewood has been through an occasional rough patch at times but very recently it has been classic and hilarious.  I rate a 5.

text: Remember the old Thrasher magazine ads where they advertised the t-shirts that had Elvis with stink lines coming from behind him that bore the caption "Elvis Had A Stinky Butt"?  How great would that have been if that's what was in Ray's bat.

name: herbincommando
text:
@ billylk
The firefox devs know about alt text being cut off, it's a logged bug in their db, but they refuse to fix it, here's a link to one of the bugs, https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=149157

Other comic sites have the same problem, people complain but they dont do anything.
LOBBY FIREFOX, TELL THEM WE WANT OUR ALT TEXT!!! MAKE THEM LISTEN!

name: boojit
text: Again, just so it doesn't get missed... here's a plugin that fixes it.

name: zefiel
text: I saw it the first time but i reply here. Dude, ten kinds of THANK YOU! my firefox achewood viewing experience will be complete now. Firefox and tight dudes in the know like you are the best.

name: herbincommando
text:
simply stated...
you saved the day
you're a hero

name: boojit
text: You and zefiel are welcome! Also thanks for recognizing that I am a TRUE straight-up American Hero who gives little thought to my own personal safety when saving others from certain doom. I have been trying to tell people this for years.

name: flynn
text: Oh hell yes that is rad. You are a rad friend.

name: lastlarf
text: If you right click on the image and then select properties you can read the alt text there.

name: bogmad
text: I thought it was just a bit of stubbornness, not precisely a bug, on the firefox folk's part, like bitching about how "ain't" has no place in the dictionary. Technically it's incorrect since alt text is supposed to be INSTEAD of the text when you decide not to show images, but IE started using it like the TITLE command and everyone followed suit, making it the accepted way of things.  Title-text just don't sound right when remarked upon in internet forums and whatnot though.

name: zem
text: actually these comics do all use title text instead of alt text, we just call it alt text. the "bug" as it's filed is that firefox cuts off long and multi-line title text in the tooltip.

text: this is too much comments

name: radishes
text: Right click on the image and view properties.  It's in there, under "title."  You can scroll the field with your mouse or keyboard.
